The '''Boss Update''' is the name of the update for ''[[Pocket Edition]]'', ''[[Windows 10 Edition]]'', ''[[Gear VR Edition]]'', and ''[[New Nintendo 3DS Edition]]'' that focused on adding bosses to the game, aside from the [[ender dragon]].

On ''Pocket Edition'', ''Windows 10 Edition'', and ''Gear VR Edition'', it released as [[Pocket Edition v0.16.0 alpha|alpha version v0.16.0]] on October 21, 2016 for all platforms<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20161022094949/https://www.mojang.com/2016/10/add-ons-realms-uploads-sponges-pocket-win-10-updated-to-016/</ref> aside from iOS, which released a few days later on October 25, 2016.<ref>{{tweet|tomcc|791060264917622784|MCPE 0.16 is out on iOS right now :)|25 Oct 2016}}</ref>  On ''New Nintendo 3DS Edition'', it released as version [[New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.3.12|1.3.12]] on January 30/31, 2018.

The official name for the update, the ''Boss Update'', was revealed on August 29, 2016 in a blog post on the Mojang website.<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20160901030941/http://www.mojang.com/2016/08/sneak-peek-boss-update-is-coming-to-pocket-and-windows-10/</ref>

== Notable features ==
{{main|Pocket Edition v0.16.0 alpha|New Nintendo 3DS Edition 1.3.12}}
; New [[block]]s
* [[File:Beacon JE4 BE1.png|32px]] [[Beacon]]
** Crafted using a [[Nether star]] surrounded by five [[glass]] and three [[obsidian]].
** Requires a pyramid structure composed of either iron, gold, diamond, or emerald.
*** The more tier to the pyramid, the more status effects become available.
** When placed on top of the pyramid structure, it shoots out a beam of light.
** Entering its GUI shows a list of status effect depending on how many pyramid tiers are available, and will activate those effects upon inserting either an [[iron ingot]], [[gold ingot]], [[diamond]], or [[emerald]].
* [[File:Wet Sponge JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Wet Sponge]]
** Obtained after using a [[sponge]] in an area of water.
** Can be smelted to become sponge again.
* New prismarine blocks, all can be found in [[ocean monument]]s:
** [[File:Prismarine JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Prismarine]]
*** Can be crafted using four [[prismarine shard]]s.
** [[File:Prismarine Bricks JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Prismarine Bricks]]
*** Can be crafted using nine [[prismarine shard]]s.
** [[File:Dark Prismarine JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Dark Prismarine]]
*** Can be crafted using an ink sac surrounded by eight [[prismarine shard]]s.
** [[File:Sea Lantern JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Sea Lantern]]
*** Can be crafted using four [[prismarine shard]]s and five [[prismarine crystal]]s in a + formation.

; New [[item]]s
* [[File:Nether Star JE2 BE1.png|32px]] [[Nether Star]]
** Obtained as a drop from [[wither]]s.
** Used to craft a [[beacon]].
* [[File:Prismarine Crystals JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Prismarine Crystals]]
** Obtained as drops from [[guardian]]s and [[elder guardian]]s.
** Used to craft [[sea lantern]]s.
* [[File:Prismarine Shard JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Prismarine Shard]]
** Obtained as drops from [[guardian]]s and [[elder guardian]]s.
** Used to craft prismarine blocks.
* New [[potion]]:
** {{Animate|Potion of Decay BE1.png; Splash Potion of Decay BE1.png|32px}} [[Potion of Decay]]
*** Only available through [[command]]s or through the [[Creative]] mode inventory.
* New [[tipped arrow]]:
** [[File:Arrow of Decay BE1.png|32px]] [[Arrow of Decay]]
* [[Spawn egg]]s:
** [[File:Elder Guardian Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Elder Guardian Spawn Egg
** [[File:Guardian Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Guardian Spawn Egg

; New [[mob]]s
* [[File:Guardian Revision 1.png|32px]] [[Guardian]]
** Spawns in [[ocean monument]]s.
** Attacks players and [[squid]] with a beam that charges gradually.
** Players that try to attack it while its spikes are deployed causes them to receive [[Thorns]]-like damage.
** Drops [[prismarine shard]]s, [[prismarine crystal]]s, and [[raw fish]] when killed.
* [[File:Elder Guardian Revision 1.png|32px]] [[Elder Guardian]]
** Three spawn in [[ocean monument]]s.
** When in close proximity to a ocean monument, an elder guardian inflicts the player [[Mining Fatigue]] III for 5 minutes.
** Has similar attacks and mechanics to regular guardians, but with greater health and more powerful attacks.
** Drops [[wet sponge]], [[raw fish]], and [[prismarine crystal]]s when killed.
* [[File:Wither JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Wither]]
** A new boss mob summoned by placing four [[soul sand]] in a T-shape, and three [[wither skeleton skull]]s on top of it.
** Upon summoning, the wither slowly charges up and is invincible. After a few seconds, the area around the wither explodes and it starts attacking players and non-undead mobs.
** Its heads can fire wither skulls that explode upon impact.
*** When hit, players and mobs are inflicted with the [[wither (effect)|Wither status effect]].
** It can also break any nearby blocks.
** Any kills made by the wither regenerates its health.
** At half-health, the wither will put up a shield to reflect any projectiles, meaning close combat is required to finish it off.
*** Additionally, it will create an explosion and summon 3 to 4 [[wither skeleton]]s on higher difficulties.
** Drops a [[Nether star]] when killed.

; New [[Generated structures|structures]]
* [[File:Ocean Monument.png|32px]] [[Ocean monument]]
** Found in [[ocean]] biomes.
** Will spawn with [[guardian]]s and three [[elder guardian]]s.
** Prismarine blocks, [[sponge]]s, and eight [[gold block]]s can be found here.

; Other additions
* Various new option settings.
* [[Add-on]]s, which are user-created resource packs and behavior packs that can reshape the functionality of the game.

; Notable changes
* Added sounds for various items, blocks, and mobs.

== Further revisions ==
* [[Pocket Edition v0.16.1 alpha|Alpha v0.16.1]] fixed some bugs and crashes from Alpha v0.16.0.
* [[Pocket Edition v0.16.2 alpha|Alpha v0.16.2]] fixed some bugs from Alpha v0.16.1, and also added the Cartoon texture pack.
